name: Monolith Footman
description: The Monolith Footman is a large construct with solid defenses and a substantial pool of hit points, enhanced with magical properties allowing it to deal significant melee damage.
memorable: Highly resilient against various damage types and has abilities to control the battlefield, especially in fey-influenced areas.
goals: To serve as an imposing presence on the battlefield, absorbing damage and disrupting enemy actions.
relations: Constructs and fey creatures that might work together in fey-influenced areas.
environment: Typically found in locations influenced by fey magic.
strengths: Immune to poison and psychic damage, with resistances to nonmagical attacks. Can control the battlefield with its abilities.
weaknesses: Intelligence and charisma limitations make it ineffective in complex decision-making and social interactions.
attacks: Can make two attacks with a shortsword, dealing slashing damage plus additional cold or fire damage.
most_powerful_ability: Coldfire Weapons ability that enhances its attack damage with an extra 1d8 cold or fire damage.
senses: Has darkvision allowing it to see in dim light, effective in low-visibility environments.
additional_information: Critical hits destroy the construct and affect nearby creatures.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Can utilize illusion tactics to mislead enemies.
test_queries: large magical creature immune to poison
tough construct with fey fire weapons
